shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 3r-31v) II) Anaphoras (fols. 31v-110r) II-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 31va l.12–41vb l.17) II-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 42ra l.1- 45vb l.5), preceded by the “Testament that Jesus Christ told…” II-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 45va l.6-52vb l.10) II-4) Anaphora of St. John, son of Thunder (fols. 53ra l.1–59vb l.8) II-5) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 59va l.11–65vb l.27), preceded by the Nicene Creed (Ṣälotä haymanot) II-6) Anaphora of St. Athanasius (fols. 66ra l.3–72vb l.15) II-7) Anaphora of St. Basil of Cesarea, followed by Śǝrʿatä bäwiʾotä qǝddase zähośaʾǝna (fols. 73ra l.4–79vb l.15) II-8) Anaphora of St. Gregory of Nyssa (fols. 80ra l.1- 84vb l.19) II-9) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius (fols. 85ra l.1–90rb l.20) II-10) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 90va l.1– 95vb l.4) II-11) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 95ra l.10–99vb l.24) II-12) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 100ra l.4– 104rb l.18) II-13) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus (fols. 104va l.1-107rb l.22) II-14) The Second Anaphora of St. Gregory (fols. 107va l.1–110rb l.18) III) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 112r-123r)
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: Additiones 1 and 2 mention wäyzäro Bǝrritu as the donor. Elsewhere, ʾabunä Kidanä Maryam, Wälättä Ṣadǝqan, Gäbrä ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer are mentioned (s. fol. 59vb).

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 20th cent. The Ms. has been paid and then donated to Qärsäbär Mikaʾel in 1966 A.M. (= 1973/74 A.D.) (s. Additiones 1-2). The dates 1965 A.M. (= 1972/73 A.D.) and 1973 are written after the text of the Nicene Creed on fol. 60r) in European numerals.

txstates.txstate: Some fols. are damaged by rodents. Some fols. are worn and dirty.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, small x, x-form, criss cross, chain).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 1; 2, stub before 2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-19v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – X(8/fols. 75r-82v) – XI(8/fols. 83r-90v) – XII(8/fols. 91r-98v) – XIII(8/fols. 99r-106v) – XIV(8/fols. 107r-111v) – XV(8/fols. 112r-119v) – XVI(6/fols. 120r-125v).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible (s. fol. 57r). Ruling pricks are visible (s. fol. 59r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible (s. fol. 57r). Ruling pricks are visible (s. fol. 59r). Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Titles of texts and their incipits; nomina sacra; the name of the Emperor in the supplication for the reigning monarch (e.g., fol. 122v); directives to the ministers; abbreviations; titles of larger parts of the Ms. in the table of contents (fol. 2v).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ፡ for ይቤ፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይቤ፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይቤ፡ ሕዝብ፡

otherdetails.otherdetail: The text of the Ms. was probably copied from a printed book (?).

additional.det: The note mentions that the Ms. has been donated to Qärsäbär Mikaʾel in 1966 A.M. (= 1973/74 A.D.) by wäyzäro Bǝrritu.
Hardly readable. The note mentions that wäyzäro Bǝrritu paid for the Ms. 110 Birr, in 1966 A.M. (= 1973/74 A.D.).

extras.extra: - Fol. 2v: Table of contents precedes the texts, with the titles of the texts and their ordinal numbers (the pages are not indicated). In the table of contents the Anaphoras go first, followed by Śǝrʿatä qǝddase, while in the Ms. itself the order is vice versa. - Fols. 4r, 13v, 14r, 17v, 20v, 22v, 35r, 60r, 61r, 80r, 85r, 104v: Notes in the upper margin. - Fol. 29v. Note in the bottom margin. - Fols. 12rb, 41vb, 52vb, 72va, 72vb, 79rb, 79va, 84vb, 90rb, 99vb, 107rb, 110v: Lists of masculine and feminine personal names, only partly coincide with one another. - Running titles appear throughout the Ms. in the upper margins.

drawing.details: Crudely drawn object resembling a cross (?) in the upper margin.
Drawing, in red ink, of an angel armed with a sword, with a smaller figure of a wicked angel to his left, and three additional figures, two of which are apparently the sun and the moon.

frames.frame: - Fol. 3r: Crude ornamental band with two lateral and one central extensions. - Fol. 31v: Crude ornamental band with one central extension. - Fol. 41v: Narrow, crude ornamental band. - Fol. 45v (before text II-3Narrow): Crude ornamental band. - Fol. 52vb: Narrow, crude ornamental band. - Fol. 59v (before text II-5): Ornamental band.
